The post describes a series of symptoms and medical conditions, including:

* Post orgasmic illness syndrome (POIS)
* Acqured acalculia (inability to perform simple mathematical tasks)
* Agoraphobia (fear of places or situations that might cause panic)

* Alexia (inability to recognize or read written words or letters)
* Amusia (inability to recognize musical tones or reproduce them)
* Anhedonia (inability to feel pleasure in normally pleasurable activities)
* Anomia (inability to recall the names of everyday objects)
* Anosognosia (inability or refusal to recognize a defect or disorder that is clinically evident)
* Apathy (lack of emotion or motivation)
* Deliberate self-harm and drug overdose
* Depression (state of feeling unhappy and without hope for the future)
* Dysarthria (difficult or unclear articulation of speech)
* Dysdiadochokinesia (impairment of rapid, alternating movements)
* Dystonia (abnormal muscle tone resulting in muscular spasm and abnormal posture)
* Euphoria (state of intense excitement and happiness)
* Hallucination (perceiving things that are not actually there)
* Headache (pain in the head or neck)
* Homicidal ideation (thoughts of committing homicide)
* Hypothermia (condition of having an abnormally low body temperature)
* Hyperthermia (condition of having a body temperature greatly above normal)
* Insomnia (inability to sleep at night)
* Mania (excessive enthusiasm or desire)
* Paralysis (loss of muscle function in part or all of the body)
* Paranoia or persecution (irrational fear of being persecuted or harmed)
* Phobia (irrational fear of a specific object, situation, or activity)
* Pyrexia (raised body temperature)
* Sciatica (pain in the back, hip, and outer side of the leg)
* Somnolence (state of feeling drowsy or ready to fall asleep)
* Tic (involuntary movement or muscle twitching)
* Tremor (involuntary quivering movement)
* Weight gain/loss (increase or decrease in body weight)

The post describes a wide range of symptoms and medical conditions, which could be indicative of various mental and physical health issues.
